00041 /* Private constants ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00042 /** @defgroup SCI_Private_Define SCI private definitions
00043   * @{
00044   */
00045 /* SCI ENSCI mask                                                                                           */
00046 #define CR_ENSCI_SET             ((u32)0x00000020)
00047 #define CR_ENSCI_RESET           ((u32)0xFFFFFFDF)
00048 
00049 /* SCI WTEN mask                                                                                            */
00050 #define CR_WTEN_SET              ((u32)0x00000004)
00051 #define CR_WTEN_RESET            ((u32)0xFFFFFFFB)
00052 /**
00053   * @}
00054   */
00055 
00056 /* Global functions ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00057 /** @defgroup SCI_Exported_Functions SCI exported functions
00058   * @{
00059   */
00060 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00061  * @brief Deinitialize the SCI peripheral registers to their default reset values.
00062  * @param SCIx: where SCIx is the selected SCI from the SCI peripherals.
00063  * @retval None
00064  ************************************************************************************************************/
00065 void SCI_DeInit(HT_SCI_TypeDef* SCIx)
00066 {
00067   RSTCU_PeripReset_TypeDef RSTCUReset = {{0}};
00068   if (SCIx == HT_SCI0)
00069   {
00070     RSTCUReset.Bit.SCI0 = 1;
00071   }
00072   #if (LIBCFG_SCI1)
00073   else
00074   {
00075     RSTCUReset.Bit.SCI1 = 1;
00076   }
00077   #endif
00078   RSTCU_PeripReset(RSTCUReset, ENABLE);
00079 }
00080 
00081 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00082  * @brief Initialize the SCI peripheral according to the specified parameters in the SCI_InitStruct.
00083  * @param SCIx: where SCIx is the selected SCI from the SCI peripherals.
00084  * @param SCI_InitStruct: pointer to a SCI_InitTypeDef structure.
00085  * @retval None
00086  ************************************************************************************************************/
00087 void SCI_Init(HT_SCI_TypeDef* SCIx, SCI_InitTypeDef* SCI_InitStruct)
00088 {
00089   u32 tmpreg;
00090 
00091   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00092   Assert_Param(IS_SCI_MODE(SCI_InitStruct->SCI_Mode));
00093   Assert_Param(IS_SCI_RETRY(SCI_InitStruct->SCI_Retry));
00094   Assert_Param(IS_SCI_CONVENTION(SCI_InitStruct->SCI_Convention));
00095   Assert_Param(IS_SCI_CARD_POLARITY(SCI_InitStruct->SCI_CardPolarity));
00096   Assert_Param(IS_SCI_CLOCK_PRESCALER(SCI_InitStruct->SCI_ClockPrescale));
00097 
00098 
00099   /*------------------------- SCI Control Register Configuration -------------------------------------------*/
00100   tmpreg = SCIx->CR;
00101   tmpreg &= 0xFFFFFFA4;
00102 
00103   tmpreg |= SCI_InitStruct->SCI_Mode | SCI_InitStruct->SCI_Retry | SCI_InitStruct->SCI_Convention |
00104             SCI_InitStruct->SCI_CardPolarity;
00105 
00106   SCIx->CR = tmpreg;
00107 
00108   /*------------------------- SCI Prescaler Register Configuration -----------------------------------------*/
00109   SCIx->PSC = SCI_InitStruct->SCI_ClockPrescale;
00110 }
00111 
00112 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00113  * @brief Initialize the SCI peripheral according to the specified parameters in the SCI_InitStruct.
00114  * @param SCI_InitStruct: pointer to a SCI_InitTypeDef structure.
00115  * @retval None
00116  ************************************************************************************************************/
00117 void SCI_StructInit(SCI_InitTypeDef* SCI_InitStruct)
00118 {
00119   /* Initialize the SCI_Mode member                                                                         */
00120   SCI_InitStruct->SCI_Mode = SCI_MODE_MANUAL;
00121 
00122   /* Initialize the SCI_Retry member                                                                        */
00123   SCI_InitStruct->SCI_Retry = SCI_RETRY_NO;
00124 
00125   /* Initialize the SCI_Convention member                                                                   */
00126   SCI_InitStruct->SCI_Convention = SCI_CONVENTION_DIRECT;
00127 
00128   /* Initialize the SCI_CardPolarity member                                                                 */
00129   SCI_InitStruct->SCI_CardPolarity = SCI_CARDPOLARITY_LOW;
00130 
00131   /* Initialize the SCI_ClockPrescale member                                                                */
00132   SCI_InitStruct->SCI_ClockPrescale = SCI_CLKPRESCALER_1;
00133 }
00134 
00135 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00136  * @brief Enable or Disable the specified SCI peripheral.
00137  * @param SCIx: where SCIx is the selected SCI from the SCI peripherals.
00138  * @param NewState: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00139  * @retval None
00140  ************************************************************************************************************/
00141 void SCI_Cmd(HT_SCI_TypeDef* SCIx, ControlStatus NewState)
00142 {
00143   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00144   Assert_Param(IS_CONTROL_STATUS(NewState));
00145 
00146   if (NewState != DISABLE)
00147   {
00148     SCIx->CR |= CR_ENSCI_SET;
00149   }
00150   else
00151   {
00152     SCIx->CR &= CR_ENSCI_RESET;
00153   }
00154 }
00155 
00156 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00157  * @brief This function is used to configure the Elementary Time Unit.
00158  * @param SCIx: where SCIx is the selected SCI from the SCI peripherals.
00159  * @param SCI_ETU: specify the SCI Elementary Time Unit.
00160  * @param SCI_Compensation: Enable or Disable the Compensation mode.
00161  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00162  *     @arg SCI_COMPENSATION_ENABLE  : Compensation mode enabled
00163  *     @arg SCI_COMPENSATION_DISABLE : Compensation mode disabled
00164  * @retval None
00165  ************************************************************************************************************/
00166 void SCI_ETUConfig(HT_SCI_TypeDef* SCIx, u32 SCI_ETU, u32 SCI_Compensation)
00167 {
00168   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00169   Assert_Param(IS_SCI_ETU(SCI_ETU));
00170   Assert_Param(IS_SCI_ETU_COMPENSATION(SCI_Compensation));
00171 
00172   SCIx->ETU = SCI_ETU | SCI_Compensation;
00173 }
00174 
00175 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00176  * @brief This function is used to set the value of SCI GuardTime.
00177  * @param SCIx: where SCIx is the selected SCI from the SCI peripherals.
00178  * @param SCI_GuardTime: specify the value of SCI GuardTime value.
00179  * @retval None
00180  ************************************************************************************************************/
00181 void SCI_SetGuardTimeValue(HT_SCI_TypeDef* SCIx, u16 SCI_GuardTime)
00182 {
00183   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00184   Assert_Param(IS_SCI_GUARDTIME(SCI_GuardTime));
00185 
00186   SCIx->GT = SCI_GuardTime;
00187 }
00188 
00189 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00190  * @brief This function is used to set the value of SCI Waiting Time.
00191  * @param SCIx: where SCIx is the selected SCI from the SCI peripherals.
00192  * @param SCI_WaitingTime: specify the value of SCI Waiting Time value.
00193  * @retval None
00194  ************************************************************************************************************/
00195 void SCI_SetWaitingTimeValue(HT_SCI_TypeDef* SCIx, u32 SCI_WaitingTime)
00196 {
00197   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00198   Assert_Param(IS_SCI_WAITING_TIME(SCI_WaitingTime));
00199 
00200   SCIx->WT = SCI_WaitingTime;
00201 }
00202 
00203 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00204  * @brief Enable or Disable the Waiting Time Counter.
00205  * @param SCIx: where SCIx is the selected SCI from the SCI peripherals.
00206  * @param NewState: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00207  * @retval None
00208  ************************************************************************************************************/
00209 void SCI_WaitingTimeCounterCmd(HT_SCI_TypeDef* SCIx, ControlStatus NewState)
00210 {
00211   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00212   Assert_Param(IS_CONTROL_STATUS(NewState));
00213 
00214   if (NewState != DISABLE)
00215   {
00216     SCIx->CR |= CR_WTEN_SET;
00217   }
00218   else
00219   {
00220     SCIx->CR &= CR_WTEN_RESET;
00221   }
00222 }
00223 
00224 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00225  * @brief Sends a data byte through the SCI peripheral.
00226  * @param SCIx: where SCIx is the selected SCI from the SCI peripherals.
00227  * @param SCI_Data: byte to be transmitted.
00228  * @retval None
00229  ************************************************************************************************************/
00230 void SCI_SendData(HT_SCI_TypeDef* SCIx, u8 SCI_Data)
00231 {
00232   SCIx->TXB = SCI_Data;
00233 }
00234 
00235 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00236  * @brief Returns the received data through the SCI peripheral.
00237  * @param SCIx: where SCIx is the selected SCI from the SCI peripherals.
00238  * @retval The value of the received data.
00239  ************************************************************************************************************/
00240 u8 SCI_ReceiveData(HT_SCI_TypeDef* SCIx)
00241 {
00242   return ((u8)SCIx->RXB);
00243 }
00244 
00245 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00246  * @brief Determines the SCI output clock signal is driven by hardware or software.
00247  * @param SCIx: where SCIx is the selected SCI from the SCI peripherals.
00248  * @param SCI_CLKMode: specify the SCI clock pin mode.
00249  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00250  *     @arg SCI_CLK_SOFTWARE : SCI output clock is controlled by software
00251  *     @arg SCI_CLK_HARDWARE : SCI output clock is controlled by hardware
00252  * @retval None
00253  ************************************************************************************************************/
00254 void SCI_ClockModeConfig(HT_SCI_TypeDef* SCIx, u32 SCI_CLKMode)
00255 {
00256   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00257   Assert_Param(IS_SCI_CLK_MODE(SCI_CLKMode));
00258 
00259   if (SCI_CLKMode != SCI_CLK_SOFTWARE)
00260   {
00261     SCIx->CCR |= SCI_CLK_HARDWARE;
00262   }
00263   else
00264   {
00265     SCIx->CCR &= SCI_CLK_SOFTWARE;
00266   }
00267 }
00268 
00269 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00270  * @brief Output the SCI clock pin low or high by software.
00271  * @param SCIx: where SCIx is the selected SCI from the SCI peripherals.
00272  * @param SCI_CLK: specify if the SCI clock pin to be high or low.
00273  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00274  *     @arg SCI_CLK_HIGH : Software drive SCI output clock high
00275  *     @arg SCI_CLK_LOW  : Software drive SCI output clock low
00276  * @retval None
00277  ************************************************************************************************************/
00278 void SCI_SoftwareClockCmd(HT_SCI_TypeDef* SCIx, u32 SCI_CLK)
00279 {
00280   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00281   Assert_Param(IS_SCI_CLK(SCI_CLK));
00282 
00283   if (SCI_CLK != SCI_CLK_LOW)
00284   {
00285     SCIx->CCR |= SCI_CLK_HIGH;
00286   }
00287   else
00288   {
00289     SCIx->CCR &= SCI_CLK_LOW;
00290   }
00291 }
00292 
00293 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00294  * @brief Output the SCI DIO pin low or high by software.
00295  * @param SCIx: where SCIx is the selected SCI from the SCI peripherals.
00296  * @param SCI_DIO: specify if the SCI DIO pin to be high or low.
00297  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00298  *     @arg SCI_DIO_HIGH : Drive SCI DIO signal high
00299  *     @arg SCI_DIO_LOW  : Drive SCI DIO signal low
00300  * @retval None
00301  ************************************************************************************************************/
00302 void SCI_OutputDIO(HT_SCI_TypeDef* SCIx, u32 SCI_DIO)
00303 {
00304   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00305   Assert_Param(IS_SCI_DIO(SCI_DIO));
00306 
00307   if (SCI_DIO != SCI_DIO_LOW)
00308   {
00309     SCIx->CCR |= SCI_DIO_HIGH;
00310   }
00311   else
00312   {
00313     SCIx->CCR &= SCI_DIO_LOW;
00314   }
00315 }
00316 
00317 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00318  * @brief Enable or Disable the specified SCI interrupt.
00319  * @param SCIx: where SCIx is the selected SCI from the SCI peripherals.
00320  * @param SCI_Int: specify the SCI interrupt source to be enabled or disable.
00321  *   This parameter can be any combination of the following values:
00322  *     @arg SCI_INT_PAR  : SCI parity error interrupt
00323  *     @arg SCI_INT_RXC  : SCI received character interrupt
00324  *     @arg SCI_INT_TXC  : SCI transmitted character interrupt
00325  *     @arg SCI_INT_WT   : SCI waiting timer interrupt
00326  *     @arg SCI_INT_CARD : SCI card insert/remove interrupt
00327  *     @arg SCI_INT_TXBE : SCI transmit buffer empty interrupt
00328  * @param  NewState: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00329  * @retval None
00330  ************************************************************************************************************/
00331 void SCI_IntConfig(HT_SCI_TypeDef* SCIx, u32 SCI_Int, ControlStatus NewState)
00332 {
00333   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00334   Assert_Param(IS_SCI_INT(SCI_Int));
00335   Assert_Param(IS_CONTROL_STATUS(NewState));
00336 
00337   if (NewState != DISABLE)
00338   {
00339     SCIx->IER |= SCI_Int;
00340   }
00341    else
00342   {
00343     SCIx->IER &= ~SCI_Int;
00344   }
00345 }
00346 
00347 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00348  * @brief Get the status of specified SCI flag.
00349  * @param SCIx: where SCIx is the selected SCI from the SCI peripherals.
00350  * @param SCI_Flag: specify the flag that is to be check.
00351  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00352  *     @arg SCI_FLAG_PAR  : SCI parity error flag
00353  *     @arg SCI_FLAG_RXC  : SCI received character flag
00354  *     @arg SCI_FLAG_TXC  : SCI transmitted character flag
00355  *     @arg SCI_FLAG_WT   : SCI waiting timer flag
00356  *     @arg SCI_FLAG_CARD : SCI card insert/remove flag
00357  *     @arg SCI_FLAG_TXBE : SCI transmit buffer empty flag
00358  * @retval SET or RESET
00359  ************************************************************************************************************/
00360 FlagStatus SCI_GetFlagStatus(HT_SCI_TypeDef* SCIx, u32 SCI_Flag)
00361 {
00362   u32 statusreg = 0;
00363   FlagStatus bitstatus = RESET;
00364 
00365   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00366   Assert_Param(IS_SCI_FLAG(SCI_Flag));
00367 
00368   statusreg = SCIx->SR;
00369 
00370   if ((statusreg & SCI_Flag) != (u32)RESET)
00371   {
00372     bitstatus = SET;
00373   }
00374   else
00375   {
00376     bitstatus = RESET;
00377   }
00378 
00379   return bitstatus;
00380 }
00381 
00382 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00383  * @brief Clears the flag status of specified SCI flag.
00384  * @param SCIx: where SCIx is the selected SCI from the SCI peripherals.
00385  * @param SCI_Flag: specify the flag to be cleared.
00386  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00387  *     @arg SCI_FLAG_PAR : SCI parity error flag
00388  *     @arg SCI_FLAG_TXC : SCI transmitted character flag
00389  *     @arg SCI_FLAG_WT  : SCI waiting timer flag
00390  * @retval None
00391  ************************************************************************************************************/
00392 void SCI_ClearFlag(HT_SCI_TypeDef* SCIx, u32 SCI_Flag)
00393 {
00394   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00395   Assert_Param(IS_SCI_CLEAR_FLAG(SCI_Flag));
00396 
00397   if (SCI_Flag != SCI_FLAG_WT)
00398   {
00399     SCIx->SR &= ~SCI_Flag;
00400   }
00401   else
00402   {
00403     SCIx->CR &= CR_WTEN_RESET;
00404     SCIx->CR |= CR_WTEN_SET;
00405   }
00406 }
00407 
00408 #if (LIBCFG_PDMA)
00409 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00410  * @brief Enable or disables the SCI PDMA interface.
00411  * @param SCIx: where SCIx is the selected SCI from the SCI peripherals.
00412  * @param SCI_PDMAREQ: specify the SCI PDMA transfer request to be enabled or disabled.
00413  *   This parameter can be any combination of the following values:
00414  *     @arg SCI_PDMAREQ_TX : Tx PDMA transfer request
00415  *     @arg SCI_PDMAREQ_RX : Rx PDMA transfer request
00416  * @param  NewState: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00417  * @retval None
00418  ************************************************************************************************************/
00419 void SCI_PDMACmd(HT_SCI_TypeDef* SCIx, u32 SCI_PDMAREQ, ControlStatus NewState)
00420 {
00421   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00422   Assert_Param(IS_SCI_PDMA_REQ(SCI_PDMAREQ));
00423   Assert_Param(IS_CONTROL_STATUS(NewState));
00424 
00425   if (NewState != DISABLE)
00426   {
00427     SCIx->CR |= SCI_PDMAREQ;
00428   }
00429   else
00430   {
00431     SCIx->CR &= ~SCI_PDMAREQ;
00432   }
00433 }
00434 #endif
